name: Striker's Potatoes O'Brien
author: STRIKER
summary: I'm tired of buying this at the store, so I decided to make my own. In my opinion, this is the best way to prepare potatoes for a typical breakfast. This recipe lasts a long time in the freezer. Just pull the bag out of the freezer and toss as much as you want onto a hot pan or griddle. Add more vegetable oil when cooking if needed. Enjoy.
ingredients: 1 large green bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch dice
1 large red bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch dice
directions: Place the potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 10 minutes
Drain, then set aside until cool
Combine the potatoes, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, and onion in a mixing bowl
Drizzle in the vegetable oil, and gently stir until evenly coated
Spoon the mixture into resealable freezer bags
Store the mixture in the freezer
To prepare, cook the frozen mixture in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until crispy and golden brown, stirring occasionally, about 20 minutes
